answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Hi Robin,
This 2009 report from a compendium of private firms (Itron, KEMA, RLW Analytics, Architectual Energy Corporation) was submitted to Pacific Gas and Electric, one of the dominant California State public utility companies. 
http://www.calmac.org/publications/PGE_PotentialStudy_Vol1_05242006.pdf
This report focuses primarily on energy efficiency potential and overcoming market barriers in commercial and residential zones. 
This EPA Wastewater Fact Sheet is more like a checklist for implementing a local wastewater conservation plan. 
http://www.p2pays.org/energy/WastePlant.pdf
This May 2009 report written for a consortium of California and Vermont utility companies focuses on "first cost" issues related to energy efficiency, namely in reducing obstacles to both public and private investment in green energy technology. It provides sample loan agreements, housing-related policy recommendations and a host of other financing mechanisms designed to provide incentives for clean energy investment. 
http://uc-ciee.org/energyeff/documents/resfinancing.pdf
The US Department of Energy website is also a great resource to start at if you're looking to find more efficiency studies or get in touch with someone who can help to narrow your search or point you in the right direction.
http://www.eere.energy.gov/
Hope this helps you get started. Good luck with the rest of your search!
Derek Johnson
